examples: He's gone completely out of his wits .

definitions.definition: Intellectual ability; faculty of thinking, reasoning.
examples: Where she has gone to is beyond the wit of man to say.

definitions.definition: The ability to think quickly; mental cleverness, especially under short time constraints.
examples: My father had a quick wit and a steady hand.
The opportunity was right in front of you, and you didn't even have the wit to take it!

definitions.definition: Humour , especially when clever or quick.
examples: The best man's speech was hilarious, full of wit and charm.

definitions.definition: A person who tells funny anecdotes or jokes; someone witty.
examples: Your friend is quite a wit , isn't he?

main_definition: ( now usually in the plural ) Sanity .
secondary_definitions: ( obsolete , usually in the plural ) The senses .
Intellectual ability; faculty of thinking, reasoning.
The ability to think quickly; mental cleverness, especially under short time constraints.
Humour , especially when clever or quick.
A person who tells funny anecdotes or jokes; someone witty.
